tool.name: bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
tool.command:
bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
## Default section --exclude "${sec_default.exclude}" --SnpGap "${sec_default.SnpGap}" --IndelGap "${sec_default.IndelGap}" --include "${sec_default.include}" --mode "${sec_default.mode}" --output "${sec_default.output}" --output-type "${sec_default.select_output_type}" #set values_sec_default_regions = '","'.join([str($value) for $value in $sec_default.regions_repeat]) --regions "${values_sec_default_regions}" --regions-file "${sec_default.regions_file}" --soft-filter "${sec_default.soft_filter}" --set-GTs "${sec_default.select_set_GTs}" #set values_sec_default_targets = '","'.join([str($value) for $value in $sec_default.targets_repeat]) --targets "${values_sec_default_targets}" --targets-file "${sec_default.targets_file}"

param.help: exclude sites for which the expression is true (see man page for details)
param.label: Exclude
param.name: exclude

param.help: filter SNPs within <int> base pairs of an indel
param.label: Snpgap
param.name: SnpGap

param.help: filter clusters of indels separated by <int> or fewer base pairs allowing only one to pass
param.label: Indelgap
param.name: IndelGap

param.help: include only sites for which the expression is true (see man page for details
param.label: Include
param.name: include

param.help: "+": do not replace but add to existing FILTER; "x": reset filters at sites which pass
param.label: Mode
param.name: mode

param.help: write output to a file [standard output]
param.label: Output
param.name: output

param.help: restrict to comma-separated list of regions
param.label: Regions
param.name: regions

param.help: restrict to regions listed in a file
param.label: Regions File
param.name: regions_file

param.help: annotate FILTER column with <string> or unique filter name ("Filter%d") made up by the program ("+")
param.label: Soft Filter
param.name: soft_filter

option.value: set genotypes of failed samples to missing (.) or ref (0)

param.help: similar to -r but streams rather than index-jumps
param.label: Targets
param.name: targets

param.help: similar to -R but streams rather than index-jumps
param.label: Targets File
param.name: targets_file
